lead_paragraph: Popular opinion in the kingdom appears to show a wave of approval for the death sentences being carried out, and accusations of hypocrisy at the way the events have been portrayed in the West.
snippet: Popular opinion in the kingdom appears to show a wave of approval for the death sentences being carried out, and accusations of hypocrisy at the way the events have been portrayed in the West.

headline.main: Saudis Applaud a Tougher Line Against Tehran
headline.print_headline: Saudis Applaud a Tougher Line Against Tehran

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

abstract: Many Saudis fully support government's execution of Shiite dissident Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, with some even going so far as to say action allows Saudi Arabia to assume mantle of mainstream Sunni resistance in face of Islamic State group's influence; many observers have noted that Saudi government would have faced far more domestic popular anger if it spared Sheikh Nimr, as 43 Sunnis accused of terrorism were executed on same day.
